posts.post_content: ArachibutyrophobiaLast time I checked you can only play lands(like Gemstone Mine) on YOUR turn. Gemstone Caverns gets out earlier then that, making it work on Turn 0.
posts.html:
ArachibutyrophobiaLast time I checked you can only play lands(like Gemstone Mine) on YOUR turn. Gemstone Caverns gets out earlier then that, making it work on Turn 0.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: qaq456 (1/26/2011 3:55:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@person1234 - Gemstone Cavern is the one with the luck counter and starts out in play under certain conditions. Gemstone Mine has "mining counters" on it and is not in play when the game starts.  
  
@Arachibutyrophobia - He was explaining why it's "Turn 0". If you have Gemstone Cavern out with a luck counter, you can play all of it before their upkeep. Since you're going second (or at least not first) you haven't had your first turn yet - hence Turn 0. So, no. Gemstone Mine will not work to do it on "Turn 0".
posts.html:
@person1234 - Gemstone Cavern is the one with the luck counter and starts out in play under certain conditions. Gemstone Mine has "mining counters" on it and is not in play when the game starts.

@Arachibutyrophobia - He was explaining why it's "Turn 0". If you have Gemstone Cavern out with a luck counter, you can play all of it before their upkeep. Since you're going second (or at least not first) you haven't had your first turn yet - hence Turn 0. So, no. Gemstone Mine will not work to do it on "Turn 0".

Posted By: CeremonialBathory (12/8/2010 8:40:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @Arachibutyrophobia: I think you have [Gemstone Caverns](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gemstone Caverns) down before the game starts by having it in your starting hand and going second, then on your opponent's turn, you do the combo as an instant. Overall, the chances of getting the turn 0 win are probably rather slim (that's how it seems to me, but I've never played with it). But it is very potent, and you can still probably get a pretty good chance at it maybe turn 2 or 3, as long as you don't start wiff too many 0 mana artifacts

posts.post_content:
I'm not much of a 1st turn win-person, so my combo with Protean hulk and [Flash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flash) would probably be something like:  
  
T1: Mountain, [Amulet of Vigor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Amulet of Vigor)  
T2: Island (or any [Karoo](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karoo)-type land that adds ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) - you may float the other land's mana), [Flash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flash) the Hulk and drop [Primeval Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primeval Titan) + 4 [Dryad Arbor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dryad Arbor), search for some more lands with Titan's etb ability and cast [Burst of Speed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burst of Speed). You can choose to attack with or without the Dryads. If you choose not to, you'll have 7 untapped lands in your second main phase (8 if you floated a red land off the Mountain with a [Karoo](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karoo)-land). If you choose to attack with the dryads, you'll have 3-4 untapped lands. Either way, you'll have enough mana to cast some additional spells before passing the turn, and you'll have swung for 6-10 dmg on your 2nd turn.  
  
If you don't hit the jackpot and have all four card... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I'm not much of a 1st turn win-person, so my combo with Protean hulk and Flash would probably be something like:

T1: Mountain, Amulet of Vigor
T2: Island (or any Karoo-type land that adds - you may float the other land's mana), Flash the Hulk and drop Primeval Titan + 4 Dryad Arbor, search for some more lands with Titan's etb ability and cast Burst of Speed. You can choose to attack with or without the Dryads. If you choose not to, you'll have 7 untapped lands in your second main phase (8 if you floated a red land off the Mountain with a Karoo-land). If you choose to attack with the dryads, you'll have 3-4 untapped lands. Either way, you'll have enough mana to cast some additional spells before passing the turn, and you'll have swung for 6-10 dmg on your 2nd turn.

If you don't hit the jackpot and have all four card... (see all)

posts.post_content:
This card is the best friend of any heavily armed legendary creature deck, or even any multi-coloured green deck. Instead of having 2 [Arcanis the Omnipotent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcanis the Omnipotent)s, 2 [Kazuul, tyrant of the cliffs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kazuul, tyrant of the cliffs), and 2 [Riku of two reflections](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Riku of two reflections), I can just have one of each and one or two of this thing, with only a gain in average performance! Heck, put it in with some nice [dryad arbor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dryad arbor)s, and this is by far the best creature summoning tool ever!  
  
To put it in the words of the simple: "Hulk smash!"
